instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1297: What is A1297? A1297 is a model number for a 17 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Early 2009, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011 with EMC 2272, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2390, 820-2610, 820-2849, 820-2914..
definitions.820-2914: What is 820-2914? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).

threads.title: MacbookPro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1297</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not turning on
threads.message:
Hi
This old machine is not turning on. I did check the voltages which i found normal except <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>.  when i tried it in SMC bypass mode. It start booting but didn't properly. I had apple logo screen with boot bar and it kept rebooting in SMC bypass mode. <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> is coming from <CHIP>U1800</CHIP>. Could you please shed some light on it? what and where i have to work on?

Thanks

threads.title: MacbookPro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1297</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not turning on
threads.message:
There is no problem with power on sequence, if machine boots in SMC bypass mode.
Some SMC sensor may prevent to boot in normal mode.
First be sure to use original 85W charger.

But looks like you have problems with GPU too, as machine never gets logged into macOS.
